Idiom (Manchu): Booi jalin be tuwame sain be mutereme
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Appreciate what you have at home before seeking elsewhere.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Value your own family and possessions.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common wisdom among early Qing Manchus emphasizing family unity.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Manchu): [po.i ʤa.lin be tu.wa.me sa.in be mu.te.re.me]
First Example Sentence: Muse de ere sain be akū oci, booi jalin be tuwame sain be mutereme sembi.
Second Example Sentence: Mini ama ere gisun be gisureme, booi jalin be tuwame sain be mutereme sembi.
Third Example Sentence: Niyalma sain akū oci, booi sain be mutereme sembi.

Idiom (Manchu): Sargan be jifi, urgun be suha
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Act wisely and keep your intentions pure.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Traditional Manchu moral teaching used in administrative training.
First Example Sentence: Ama be tuwame sembi, sargan be jifi, urgun be suha seme.
Second Example Sentence: Ambasa de sargan be jifi, urgun be suha seme sain bi.
Third Example Sentence: Muse de sain i ambasa sargan be jifi, urgun be suha sembi.

Idiom (Manchu): Turgun be hūlafi, sain be tuwame
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Learn from mistakes to achieve goodness.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Manchu proverb emphasizing learning from failure.
First Example Sentence: Muse de turgun be hūlafi, sain be tuwame sembi.
Second Example Sentence: Niyalma akū be hūlafi sain be tuwame seme bihe.
Third Example Sentence: Bi ilibuha de turgun be hūlafi sain be tuwame sembi.

Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Rooted in Manchu clan teaching traditions.
First Example Sentence: Ama be gisureme sembi, juse be alime giyan seme.
Second Example Sentence: Muse de juse be alime giyan seme seme sain bi.
Third Example Sentence: Niyalma juse be alime giyan seme akū oci, urgun akū oho.

Idiom (Manchu): Ton be jakūfi sain be mutereme
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common idiom in Qing-era Manchu communities about diligence.
First Example Sentence: Muse de ton be jakūfi sain be mutereme sembi.
Second Example Sentence: Si sain akū oci, ton be jakūfi sain be mutereme seme bihe.
Third Example Sentence: Mini eme be gisureme sembi, ton be jakūfi sain be mutereme.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Speak with honesty from the heart.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Derived from Manchu concept of moral clarity (giyan).
First Example Sentence: Si be tuwame sembi, giyan be gisure seme.
Second Example Sentence: Mini ama giyan be gisure seme sain bi.
Third Example Sentence: Muse de niyalma giyan be gisure seme tacimbi.

Idiom (Manchu): Urun de sain i giyan be hūlha
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Traditional Manchu optimism seen in folk tales.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Manchu): [u.run de sa.in i ɡi.jan be xu.lxa]
First Example Sentence: Muse de urun de sain i giyan be hūlha seme sembi.
Second Example Sentence: Bi akū be tuwame, urun de sain i giyan be hūlha sembi.
Third Example Sentence: Si sain akū oci, urun de sain i giyan be hūlha seme bihe.

Idiom (Manchu): Sain i gūnin be hūlha akū
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Moral reminder used in religious Manchu sayings.
First Example Sentence: Bi sain i gūnin be hūlha akū seme sembi.
Second Example Sentence: Si sain i gūnin be hūlha akū seme tacimbi.
Third Example Sentence: Muse de sain i gūnin be hūlha akū seme bihe.

Idiom (Manchu): Hūlha be sufi sain be mutereme
First Example Sentence: Muse de hūlha be sufi sain be mutereme seme sembi.
Second Example Sentence: Bi akū be sufi sain be mutereme seme oho.
Third Example Sentence: Si be hūlha be sufi sain be mutereme seme tacimbi.

Idiom (Manchu): Tuwan i boo de sain be jakūfi
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Keep peace in one’s own home.
First Example Sentence: Muse de tuwan i boo de sain be jakūfi sembi.
Second Example Sentence: Si tuwan i boo de sain be jakūfi seme tacimbi.
Third Example Sentence: Bi sain i boo de sain be jakūfi seme bihe.
